thread.title: Rumour Mill: Barca v Real for $118m PL superstar
thread.title_full: Rumour Mill: Barca v Real for $118m PL superstar

title: Rumour Mill: Barca v Real for $118m PL superstar
text:
Alli on fire against Chelsea 1:24 Rumour Mill: Barca v Real for Alli, Poch to Barca, Griezmann to Arsenal, Badstuber to City 9 minutes ago by Staff writers with wires Source: FOX SPORTS BARCELONA and Real Madrid are set to battle for Dele Alli, but he’s not the only Spurs man that the Catalan giant wants. 
Check out the latest transfer links in Rumour Mill! 
BARCELONA V REAL FOR ALLI 
Barcelona are ready to vie with Real Madrid for Tottenham starlet Dele Alli, according to The Mirror. 
The Spurs midfielder has quickly become one of the most sought after young players in football, and now the Catalan giant reportedly want him to join their superstar line-up. 
However, the 20-year-old, who’s scored seven goals in his last four games, is reportedly also being pursued by Barca’s arch-rival Real Madrid. 
But for either side to capture his signature, they will need reportedly to pay at least 70 million pounds ($118m). 
It would result in a great profit for Tottenham, who bought him for just five million pounds from MK Dons in early 2015. Tottenham's Dele Alli. Source: AP 
POCH TO REPLACE ENRIQUE 
But Alli isn’t the only Tottenham man Barcelona want to sign. 
According to The Star , the La Liga club wants Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino to potentially replace current boss Luis Enrique. 
Enrique has yet to decide whether he will continue as Barca coach, but reports from inside the club suggest he could quit after this year. 
Pochettino, who only signed a new deal at Spurs last summer, has impressed the Spanish giant while at White Hart Lane, and after managing Espanyol from 2009 to 2012, Barca reportedly believe he could be the man to take over. 
This comes after Everton boss Ronaldo Koeman was also linked with the Barcelona job. Tottenham Hotspur's Argentinian head coach Mauricio Pochettino. Source: AFP 
ARSENAL PLANNING SENSATIONAL GRIEZMANN MOVE 
Arsenal are considering a move for Atletico Madrid star Antoine Griezmann, according to Metro. 
Arsene Wenger reportedly tried to sign the France star after Euro 2016, but with Atletico slipping to sixth and manager Diego Simeone being expected to leave in the summer, the Gunners believe they have a chance of signing the 25-year-old. 
Also, with Alexis Sanchez’s future still in doubt, Wenger is reportedly keen to sign a striker. 
However, any move would likely face stiff competition from Manchester United, who have made a big-money offer to Griezmann, according to The Sun. Griezmann ends drought in win 0:37 
PEP: CITY ‘EVALUATING’ BADSTUBER DEAL 
Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has admitted they could make a move for Bayern Munich defender Holger Badstuber. 
Guardiola believes his squad is short of defensive options, especially considering they will compete across three competitions in the second half of the season following a 5-0 thrashing of West Ham in the FA Cup third round. 
The Spaniard insists there are no names on the table yet but he will hold talks with City’s director of football Txiki Begiristain in the coming days before deciding on their targets. 
He said: “We are evaluating if there’s a chance to take one (defender). I know Holger, he’s a fantastic player, a fantastic guy, but he’s a Bayern Munich player, and we should first of all speak with them and with him. Holger Badstuber. Source: Supplied 
“Now, on the table, there are no names because we had a lot of games. But now we have 10 days until Everton, so we have time to discuss with Txiki, with the club, what is the best for the rest of the season. 
“We have to speak about the situation. When we arrive now in the Premier League, in the FA Cup, in the Champions League, if something happens with the injuries we don’t have enough. 
“We have Nico [Otamendi], John [Stones] and [Aleksandar] Kolarov. Kolarov is a full-back, and of course we have Tosin [Adarabioyo], but Tosin is still young. Hopefully Vincent [Kompany] can help us, but Vincent in the last two years he was like this [with injuries].” 
CONTE WANTS 10 YEARS AT TOP - JUST DON’T TELL HIS WIFE 
Chelsea coach Antonio Conte wants to stay in top-flight management for at least another decade, but worries his wife might have other ideas. 
The Italian, who has guided Chelsea to pole position in the Premier League, says the likes of Alex Ferguson at Manchester United and current Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger have set the benchmark for management. 
“You are talking about two monsters, two great managers,” Conte said. Antonio Conte. Source: Getty Images 
“I hope to have, not completely their career, but 10 years, yes. It’s enough for me. Twenty more years? Now I’m 47. I prefer that my wife (Elisabetta) doesn’t listen to this.”“But in the moment that football is not in our life, I think probably we die.” Chelsea, five points clear in the Premier League, play Peterborough in the FA Cup third round on Sunday looking to bounce back from seeing their 13-game winning run in the league come to an end on Wednesday at Tottenham 
BILIC HAS TWO GAMES LEFT 
Slaven Bilic’s career at West Ham could be coming to an end. 
With the Hammers in 13th place and after their 5-0 FA Cup home defeat to Manchester City, the manager has two more games to save his job, according to The Sun. West Ham's manager Slaven Bilic. Source: AP 
ETO’O NOT FOR SALE, SAYS ANTALYASPOR CHIEF 
Antalyaspor’s former Cameroon international striker Samuel Eto’o is not for sale, the Turkish club’s chairman said Saturday, ending months of speculation over a move within Turkey or overseas. 
Persistent speculation linking Eto’o with a move to last season’s Super Lig champions Besiktas heightened last week when Eto’o was seen training with the Istanbul side during their camp in Antalya. 
Meanwhile there had also been talk of a move for the much-travelled player back to England, where Hull City were reported to be interested. Antalyaspor's Cameroonian striker Samuel Eto'o. Source: AFP 
But Antalyaspor club chairman Ali Safak Ozturk said the club had decided to hold on to Eto’o. 
“Great targets are only achieved with great deeds and people,” he said, quoted by the Fanatik sports website. 
“There has been various gossip about a transfer for Eto’o. We talked to the good people of our city and decided not to sell our captain, whatever happens.” In a bizarre exchange with Eto’o at the club, he asked the player “Do you love Antalyaspor? Are you staying?” Eto’o replied “Yes” on both occasions, Fanatik said. View All Comments
